description.narrative: “Partnerships for a Tolerant, Inclusive Bangladesh”, is a multi-year initiative to understand and prevent violence and extremism in Bangladesh under the Japan fund

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1. Total Number of Research Publications Produced 1.2 Number of months’ data on various forms of violence available in the website of “Bangladesh peace observatory” 1.3 Number of people who have viewed the BPO website/ platform 2.1 Total number of civil society organizations adding a PVE element to existing programming, with support of UNDP training or information materials 2.4 Number of religious leaders given training or materials to recognize and defend against extremist narratives in their communities 3.1 Number of government agencies adding a PVE element to existing programming as a result of all engagement activities

Total Number of Research Publications Produced: 9 research 1.2 Number of months’ data on various forms of violence available in the website of “Bangladesh peace observatory”: 12 months 1.3 Number of people who have viewed the BPO website/ platform: 2508 people 2.1 Total number of civil society organizations adding a PVE element to existing programming, with support of UNDP training or information materials: 8 organizations 2.4 Number of religious leaders given training or materials to recognize and defend against extremist narratives in their communities: 150 persons 3.1 Number of government agencies adding a PVE element to existing programming as a result of all engagement activities:1 agency

Output 1: Research Facility 1.1. Total Number of Research Publications Produced: 51 1.2 Number of months’ data on various forms of violence available in the website of “Bangladesh peace observatory”: 72 months 1.3 Number of people who have viewed the BPO website/ platform: 6000 people, 16000 views
Output 2: Citizen/Social Engagement 2.1: Total number of civil society organizations adding a PVE element (including diversity, peace and tolerance) to existing programming, with support of UNDP grants, training or information materials: 17 2.2 Number of viewers reached online through Digital Khichuri Challenge campaign: 113,500 (cumulative) 2.3 Number of winner teams engaged in PVE content/narrative development: 14 (cumulative) 2.4 Number of people reached through Diversity4peace activities: 200,000 4600+ offline
Output 3: Govt. Engagement 3.1 Number of government agencies adding a PVE element to existing programming as a result of all engagement activities: 3 3.2 Number of sharing and discussion on National PVE strategy: 2
